During a rushed transmission, part of the RSA private key leaked. Can you recover the message encrypted as 5135909904775347700585234975809005326823021746832348790578749137313633367376450246611064577453756690377852980488430557061389098526517918446538233845885043 using this partial key data?

The flag format is flag{...}
n=8015346435779581001464244621058735810153172607581157218958380482897636183651669109559768789068220031526049586488314008230073078580227098495735903035432421, e=4868330345607363406932404515737330167889338544903761404124282392228314700746957279042521118660923185451507594269468037404956643764979072997064641694875467, partial_p=13304409549221210627

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{2mv50mka}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 5135909904775347700585234975809005326823021746832348790578749137313633367376450246611064577453756690377852980488430557061389098526517918446538233845885043
vulnerability: partial key exposure
hint: A partial exposure of a prime number's bits can significantly weaken RSA security. Look into lattice-based techniques like Coppersmith's attack.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=8015346435779581001464244621058735810153172607581157218958380482897636183651669109559768789068220031526049586488314008230073078580227098495735903035432421, e=4868330345607363406932404515737330167889338544903761404124282392228314700746957279042521118660923185451507594269468037404956643764979072997064641694875467, partial_p=13304409549221210627
extra_info: p=83513132269711588377843396800615901078606063018596321667666469933404653118277, q=95977078310192590580335786545290199087198119037636426667724103013710007216673, Ï†(n)=8015346435779581001464244621058735810153172607581157218958380482897636183651489619349188884889261852342703680388148204048016845831891707922788788375097472
subtype: partial_key_exposure
archetype: rsa
